title: Riot, this charm nerf is actually backwards
body:
We should be making skillshot hard CCs STOP dashes across the board, a la Veigar cage. Seriously: dashes ought to be to AVOID cc, not take it with them to ride it out in a safe place. If I predict a dash, I should be rewarded for doing so, rather than watch the enemy just finish the movement and grin. If they fuck up and dash into a skillshot, THEY NEED TO PAY FOR THIS. It's hard enough to hit some of these people at all, they shouldn't still get out free. Seriously. Stop buffing mobility, not everyone likes using it or the champs that do.


EDIT: For clarity, this post is not about ahri but the interactions of hard CC and dashes.

That's more philosophy of words than it is physics.

Actually it is physics.

An unstoppable force and an unmovable object, if we think of it in terms of acceleration, are both the exact same thing, things that can not accelerate by definition. _Nothing_ will ever change their acceleration. This means if they should ever cross paths, since neither will decelerate from the collision, they will simply pass through each other.

Either that or they're both black holes and they fuse together, but you know.

Neither of these things are realistically possible, and even if they were they couldn't both exist as it would be a paradox. Thinking about it in scientific terms isn't going to get you anywhere as it's an impossibility to begin with.
It's that sort of thinking that would leave us stuck with a flat earth.

I'm happy to be proven wrong, but somehow I doubt it'll happen in my lifetime (if ever). Your theory that an immovable object and an unstoppable object would simply pass through each other only makes sense in a world where:

1. Objects with these properties can actually exist

2. Two objects can exist in the exact same point in space simultaneously

As far as my current knowledge of physics goes, our world has neither of these properties.

The comment wasn't about our universe having those properties, but rather circumstances where those properties are actually in existence; they are fundamentals OF the question being posed. 

Logically speaking if object A (unstoppable force) possesses absolute momentum with zero potential for alteration that it cannot have properties changed by interaction with other objects.

Likewise, if object B (immovable object) possesses absolute stasis, then it too has zero potential for alteration by interaction with other objects. 

Therefore if neither object can be altered in its momentum by interaction with other objects in an ABSOLUTE fashion (total immunity) then by extension neither object is affected by the other interacting with it and therefore both objects may coterminously exist should their timelines include an interaction that causes them to intersect volumetrically during the course of their mutual timelines. 

Ergo, the force passes through the object without being changed and without changing the object.
